title: Nicolas Batum's guarantee fails badly as Hornets fall to Sixers | NBA | Sporting News
text:
February 13, 2017 10:50pm EST February 13, 2017 10:50pm EST The Hornets wing wisely didn't offer a money-back pledge to fans. Nicolas Batum (Getty Images) 
Updated at 10:50 p.m. ET 
Updated at 10:50 p.m. ET 
Nicolas Batum wisely didn't offer a money-back pledge to fans when he guaranteed a win for the Hornets in Monday's game. 
The stoic Batum uncharacteristically said his team would beat the 76ers at home. Well, word definitely got around to Philly, which took control early and won 105-99 . The Sixers led by as many as 14 points in the fourth quarter. 
Sixers guard T.J. McConnell had a ready response for Batum, even if he inflated the value of his own squad a little. Philly is digging out of a big early-season hole and is 21-34 for the season. TJ McConnell puts the league on notice! #MadeinPhila pic.twitter.com/HdqhqmP2Dc â€” The Fuzz (@TheFuzzNBA) February 14, 2017 
Batum's bravado likely was rooted in the Hornets' recent struggles. Charlotte (24-31) has lost 10 of its last 11 after Monday's defeat and fallen out of the top eight in the East. Despite that, the Hornets are still just 1 1/2 games out of the No. 8 spot, behind the Pistons. To show how mediocre the bottom of the East playoff field is, the Sixers are just 4 1/2 back of Detroit. 
Batum finished with 16 points, four assists and a rebound in 38 minutes. Watch This
